thread.title: Participants celebrate life at Ascension Catholic Church run
thread.title_full: Participants celebrate life at Ascension Catholic Church run | www.statesman.com

author: Jillian Beck
title: Participants celebrate life at Ascension Catholic Church run
text:
Members of the Ascension Catholic Church in Bastrop gathered early on Oct. 3 for their first “Run for Life” to benefit the Pregnancy Resource Center.
Participants could run or walk a one-mile or 5K route during the event, with the top three male and female finishers taking home gift cards as prizes.
Most of those participating in the event dedicated their run to a cause or a purpose, such as someone they know suffering from an illness or the pro-life cause, said Priscilla Ruiz, Ascension’s youth minister and organizer of the run.
Ascension Catholic Church in Bastrop put on its first “Run for Life” event on Saturday, a one-mile and 5K run/walk to celebrate all life and benefit pro-life efforts. JILLIAN BECK/BASTROP ADVERTISER “For me, it’s rooted in awareness for our youth,” Ruiz said. “It’s a way for them to give back.”
Proceeds from the event will go toward creating a fund to purchase a 3D-sonogram machine for the Pregnancy Resource Center in Bastrop.
The run coincided with the church’s “Respect for Life” theme for October. Ruiz said she hopes to hold the event again next year.
